484865dd-b2d7-44af-87ba-abc214f5e055: A petrified character has been turned to stone and is considered {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
60d3ef68-1c04-4e37-b73d-2563ca9e0c84: A {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} creature flees from the source of its fear as best it can. If it's unable to flee, it may fight, but a frightened creature suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}.
f91434aa-00af-499b-b138-f11c58ed8d6d: A {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} character suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} or panicked.
09a39f49-4845-40c3-8d77-f8bb9cd3e98f: An enemy army has reached you and now attacks.
5caa4948-fb1b-45f5-b837-fbb514a36851: Can use abilities and cast spells as level {count} {text}
cd8a5651-f308-4063-8984-757459a7e888: Character is at the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}'s door, and escaped a deadly blow only by sheer luck. If their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} fall below their negative {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score again, then they will truly die. This condition can be removed by visiting a healer at the safe spot or by {g|SpellsRestorationGreater}Greater Restoration{/g}.
a1278bf5-44b8-41f9-ad5c-1b1f579b6125:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
d9c9c742-d404-4616-8789-98e5eeb6955b:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack roll and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.

fc324b4a-3f37-4649-8a6f-eacc07e3e0c3: This character's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} is decreased. It can be restored by {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}resting{/g}, or with the help of {g|SpellsRestorationLesser}lesser restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or some more powerful magic. A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.

A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.

271f7241-b1a9-4883-bd95-8950c693635c: When a character is entangled, they can only move at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, they cannot run or charge, and they suffer a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a –4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. An entangled character who attempts to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 + spell level), or lose the spell.
